speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Roz.  Happy New Year. [_they hug_] Or should I say "Happy New Millennium?"

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, barf, I'm so sick of talking about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, now Roz, let's not condemn the new Millennium just because you woke up in it with a hangover.  That's what ruined church for you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_to waiter_] Decaf latte, please. [_to Frasier_] I just hate how this arbitrary point on the calendar has become so significant. And as far as my hangover went, it was worth it.  I partied my ass off like a brain-damaged test monkey!

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well, allow me to congratulate you on your first science-related metaphor.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.  And what did you do?  Get all freaky and finish your list of the century's greatest thinkers?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, my New Year's was plenty exciting enough, thank you very much!  Although not exactly in the way I'd planned... _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. We flashback to the 30th of December 1999.  The apartment is still decorated for Christmas, Martin is sat in his chair as Frasier opens the door to an anxious Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Cancel the Millennium!  "Chez Henri" has burned down!

speaker: Frasier
text: Burned down?!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  Apparently, Henri was caramelizing a huge cr�me br�l�e in the shape of Puget Sound, when a sugar spark ignited a thirty-foot paper mache "Space Needle."  They're already calling it the worst centerpiece disaster in the history of Seattle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Henri built his reputation with that caramelizing torch. My God, the irony of him burning down his own restaurant with it.  It's worthy of "Oh! Henry."

speaker: Niles
text: "Oh! Henri." [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, Niles, it's too soon to joke.  What exactly are we going to do tomorrow night?  Every restaurant in town worth going to has been booked for months.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, you can join me and the boys at McGinty's. It's going to be a lot of fun, they're going to dye the beer green.

speaker: Niles
text: Why would you do that on New Year's Eve?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh well, McGinty's going in for a bypass next month and he's afraid he might not make it out for St. Paddy's Day.

speaker: Niles
text: This is a disaster!

speaker: Martin
text: No, they'll just pop in another pig valve.  You know, the only reason he needs it is because he eats so much bacon. So, the same thing that's killing him is keeping him alive. [_laughs_] There's your "Oh! Henry" story.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, maybe we can just stay in tomorrow night.

speaker: Frasier
text: On the most significant New Year's Eve of our lifetime?! I think not!

speaker: Niles
text: I should have just gone with Mel.  She and her mother are taking a hot air balloon through the wine country. [_Martin and Frasier look at him_] Well, not in the balloon, no, but I could have followed along in the recovery vehicle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait a minute!  Speaking of wine, wasn't the wine club having some sort of a party?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, at Ken Lauerbock's place in Sun Valley.  Oh, it's a huge event.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, "Auld Lang Wine!"  Niles, call to see if we're still invited.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I'm on it. _Niles exits to the kitchen whilst using his mobile as Daphne enters with some mail.  She isn't too thrilled._

speaker: Daphne
text: Bloody hell!  Five days after Christmas is over and I'm still getting these cards!  They do it on purpose, you know.  It's always from someone you forgot, and then it's too late to send one back, then they sneer at you for the rest of the year! [_reads card_] "Peace and Goodwill," my ass!  You just lost yourself a customer, Dr. Naran S. Gupta, D.D.S.!

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic_] Losing a set of English teeth, he'll feel that!

speaker: Daphne
text: This is for you, from the DMV.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh-ho, I know what this is!  The custom plates I ordered for my Winnebago! [_takes them out_] Yay!  Well, fifty bucks, but I think it says it all.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Erd... Whirr-Er"?

speaker: Daphne
text: "Rid-Worr-Yer"?

speaker: Frasier
text: "Red Wearer"!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, for God's sake!  "Road Warrior"!

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course! [_sarcastic_] For a retired man with a cane and a Winnebago, I don't know why my mind didn't go straight to it!

speaker: Niles
text: Huzzah! [_to Daphne_] Hello, Daphne. [_to Frasier_] Ken said he'd love to have us come and [_to Martin_] the more the merrier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, that's brilliant.  Dad, please, please, won't you join us?  You know what, say, let's call the travel agent.

speaker: Daphne
text: Not to rain on your parade, but you may have a tough time getting flights this late.  Donny and I had a devil of a time getting our flights to San Francisco.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Daphne, they always set aside a few choice seats for Seattle's travel elite. _Niles gleefully begins dialing his cell phone.  SMASH CUT TO:  Scene Three - The Winnebago. We quickly cut to the following day.  It seems that the Crane brothers aren't amongst the travel elite as they ride down to Sun Valley with Martin and Eddie.  A motorist beeps them from behind._

speaker: Motorist
text: [_v.o._] Pick a lane, Road Warrior!

speaker: Martin
text: See, he got it!  He-hee! [_Martin puts his thumb up at him in glee_] **ARE WE THERE YET?** _Scene Four - The Winnebago. A little while later, the Crane gang are still driving.  It is still daytime.  Frasier is now behind the wheel, Martin is in the passenger seat with Eddie whilst Niles is in a separate seat with the map._

speaker: Martin
text: Being on the road like this, it's like we're three dusty hobos sharing a box-car to parts unknown.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, if you don't take this next turn we'll end up in "Californy."

speaker: Frasier
text: Gee, Niles, you seem a little cranky.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, perhaps that's because I was rousted out of a warm bed at the crack of dawn and herded onto a Winnebago!

speaker: Martin
text: Better safe than sorry, Niles.  You know, it's 650 miles to Sun Valley, and half of that's through the mountains.

speaker: Niles
text: By the way, how are we going to explain to the wine club our arriving in a Winnebago?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just chalk it off to whimsy, Niles.  We'll call it our "Van Ordinaire!" [_laughs_] You know, besides, I'm actually enjoying this little trip through the heartland.  I feel a bit out of touch with the common man, it's nice to reconnect.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, while you're reconnecting, why don't you let me drive?

speaker: Frasier
text: I would, Niles.  It's just that, em... I need you to navigate.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you're the most important member of our crew, good buddy!

speaker: Frasier
text: The man with the map!

speaker: Niles
text: Stop patronizing me, I want to drive.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you're not good with big cars, Niles.  Remember when I tried to teach you to drive my LeSabre?  You kept panicking and pulling on the emergency brake.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's a good thing I did.  Those mailboxes weren't even slowing me down!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, did you see that sign?  "Little Red Cabin."  Do you remember those diners? [_laughs_] "Home of the Log Roller: a flank steak wrapped around a combination of eggs, cheese and onions!"  You kids used to love eating there.  You'd scream out at me, "Dad, pull over.  Quick, pull over!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, Dad, that was after we ate! _FADE TO:  Scene Five - The Winnebago. It's sometime later.  Frasier is alone in the cabin.  He's driving whilst humming along to some classical music on the stereo.  Niles enters from the sleeping area.  He looks very tired._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_noticing Niles_] Oh, Niles. [_turns stereo off_] I thought you were sleeping. _We then hear a very loud guffaw from the sleeping quarters, it's Martin._

speaker: Niles
text: I was trying to, but Dad wanted to watch the VCR.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good Lord, not "Robin and the Seven Hoods" again.

speaker: Niles
text: Worse.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, baby, you know, that was a shag-a-delic flick!

speaker: Niles
text: You know, dad, if you're quite done, I think I'll try to take a nap.

speaker: Martin
text: [_Austin-Powers-ish_] Oh, beeehave!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, you do realize that the "Austin Powers" craze is completely over!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm sorry, do I bore you?  Or do I make you randy? [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to phone_] Hello.  Yes, Niles.  I'm driving as smoothly as I can.  Any other little driving tips you'd like to give me, [_shouts back to the quarters_] why don't you just come up here and tell me to my face! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, look, another "Little Red Cabin" sign.  You know, we're not going to find anything better to eat on this highway.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, let's not be hasty, Dad.  It's five miles away, we might run over something before then! _FADE TO:  Scene Six - A Little Red Cabin. Niles, Frasier and Martin are sat in the diner reading the menus. They are sat below a huge window overlooking the car-park.  Road Warrior is parked right outside the window._

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I am so tired, I can barely read this menu.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right, Niles.  You don't have to read.  You can just point to a picture of the food you want!

speaker: Martin
text: What's this?  "A Log Roller with your choice of cheese." You can't have a Log Roller without American cheese!

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently you can't get anything in this restaurant without American cheese.  Including the menu! [_wipes cheese off menu_] _Another Winnebago, identical to the Road Warrior, pulls up in front of the RW.  An elderly couple gets out of it._

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, if you're so tired, why don't you go back to the Road Warrior and take a nap?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know, that's a good idea.  At least it'll be quiet. [_rises_]

speaker: Martin
text: I wonder if you can still get Sticky Shingles here?

speaker: Niles
text: One look at the salad bar says yes. [_exits_]

speaker: Martin
text: What looks good to you, Fras?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, Dad, you know, I think I'll have a hamburger.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you order that for me, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  You're going some place?

speaker: Frasier
text: As a matter of fact, I am.  I'm going to take a chance and reacquaint myself with an old friend of mine: America.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello there. [_sits with him_] Could I buy you a cup of coffee?  You see, I'm just a wandering city mouse, trying to get in touch with America.  Now, you, you look like you be a farmer.

speaker: Farmer
text: Oh, I get it.  You see a guy in a rural diner wearing shabby clothes and you pin your little label on him.  Well guess what, I am a farmer, but I'm also a beautiful, flawed, complicated human being and it's going to take more than a cup of coffee to get inside here.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll just go see how my father's doing.

speaker: Martin
text: How was he?

speaker: Frasier
text: Beautiful, flawed, unpleasant.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, according to the map it's about three hundred miles to Sun Valley.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's delightful, Dad.  You know what, we'll get there in plenty of time for the party.

speaker: Martin
text: Now listen, you know, your brother's going to be hungry, maybe we should bring him a sandwich.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't worry about Niles, Dad. _Meanwhile, the couple return to their Winnebago and drive away with the sleeping Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: He's so tired, let's just let him sleep for the rest of the trip.

speaker: Martin
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh sure.  It's the most exciting day of the year, Dad.  For God's sakes, you know, when Niles wakes up I guarantee the last thing he'll be thinking about is sandwiches! _End of Act One.  Act Two._ **ARE WE THERE YET?** _Scene One - The Wrong Winnebago. An old woman, Betty, and her husband, Clifford, are driving the Winnebago that Niles has fallen asleep in._

speaker: Betty
text: Oh my goodness.  Look what I just found in my pocket, the lighter I borrowed from that waitress in the restaurant. I feel terrible!

speaker: Clifford
text: Forget it, Mother.  We're not taking it back. _Meanwhile, Niles wakes up in the sleeping quarters and hears the rest of the conversation.  He is alarmed._

speaker: Betty
text: Well, I really think we should just turn around and say we're sorry and return it.

speaker: Clifford
text: I think we ought to keep it.  Our old one's nearly out of fuel anyway.

speaker: Betty
text: It doesn't make it right.  We're still criminals in the eyes of the law.

speaker: Clifford
text: There's a lot worse criminals than you and me.  Do you remember that last gun show we went to?  We must have seen at least three different people swiping boxes of shells.

speaker: Betty
text: There's one thing you can say for us, we pay for our ammo! _Niles, in panic, crouches in the corner and takes out his cell phone.  CUT TO:  Scene Two - The Winnebago. Frasier is driving as Martin chats to him._

speaker: Martin
text: So at this party tonight, there going to be a lot of shagnificent birds?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm begging you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello? [_peeved_] Niles, would you please stop doing this! [_hangs up_] _CUT TO:  Scene Three - The Wrong Winnebago. Meanwhile, Clifford and Betty are still going._

speaker: Clifford
text: I'm getting a little drowsy.

speaker: Betty
text: Well, if you're so tired, just scootch over, I'll take the wheel.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, yes, hello.  I'm being kidnapped, this is an emergency, I'm being kidnapped.  I'm in a stolen Winnebago heading east on I-84.  I can't talk any louder, I'm being stolen.  Yes, yes.  Washington plates, R-D-W-R-E-R: Road Warrior.  Yes, it does.  It does so, sound it out.  Oh, never mind, for God's sake, just save me!

speaker: Clifford
text: You know what, I'm getting sleepy, I'm going back for a little lie-down.

speaker: Betty
text: All right. [_as Clifford is just about to enter the sleeping quarters_] Oh wait Dad, look, there's another one of those "Little Red Cabin"'s.  Why don't we just stop and have some supper first?

speaker: Clifford
text: 'Cause I'm tired and I'm not hungry.

speaker: Betty
text: [_sternly_] Clifford!

speaker: Clifford
text: Well, I guess a sandwich wouldn't kill me.

speaker: Betty
text: I feel sort of funny even stopping here, it's a little like returning to the scene of the crime.

speaker: Clifford
text: Mother!  Let it go! _The couple exit the Winnebago, leaving the keys in the roof visor. Niles appears from the back and cautiously climbs into the driving seat.  He adjusts his mirror and starts the engine before driving off.  CUT TO:  Scene Four - The Winnebago. Martin and Frasier have come to a halt.  Martin exits with Eddie into the woods._

speaker: Martin
text: All right, Eddie.  Let's go sign nature's guest book!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Niles. _Throughout the following the camera switches between Niles driving the wrong Winnebago and Frasier in the Road Warrior._

speaker: Niles
text: Put your fears to rest, I've got Dad's Winnebago back!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what on earth are you talking about?  You must have had a nightmare?

speaker: Niles
text: Indeed I have, but it's over now and I've managed to give the thugs a taste of their own thieving medicine! _Frasier goes to the sleeping quarters and pulls back the curtains. No one is there.  Frasier gasps._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Niles, where are you calling from?

speaker: Niles
text: From behind the wheel of the "Road Warrior" and doing a damn fine job driving it too, I might add.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm in the "Road Warrior"!  You got in the wrong car, you idiot!  You've stolen a Winnebago!

speaker: Niles
text: Don't be absurd. _Niles looks around his Winnebago.  He sees a photo of Betty and Clifford on the wall.  He whimpers in apprehension.  He notices an ash tray on the dashboard and whimpers again.  He picks up a personalized coffee mug -- "World's Greatest Grandma." _

speaker: Niles
text: OH MY GOD! _While he has been distracted, the Winnebago has veered.  Returning his attention to the road, he desperately hauls the wheel back, then panics and pulls on the emergency break.  The Winnebago screeches to a stop and Niles falls out of his seat._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Niles.  Just keep your head, there's no need to panic!

speaker: Officer
text: [_o.s., over loudspeaker_] This is the police!  Exit the vehicle immediately with your hands above your head. _Frasier drops his mobile, raises his hands and exits.  Outside he finds Martin standing up against the side of the van, and also little Eddie with his paws above his head.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - The Little Red Cabin. Meanwhile, Betty and Clifford are still eating their meal._

speaker: Betty
text: How's that turkey club, Dad?

speaker: Clifford
text: A little dry. _Niles parks the Winnebago in the lot and gets out.  He cautiously walks past the window and enters the cabin.  FADE TO:  Scene Six - The Winnebago. The officer is explaining to the Crane men._

speaker: Officer
text: Sorry about the misunderstanding.  These papers all check out, sir. [_hands them over_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if there's nothing else, we're in a hurry to get to Sun Valley.

speaker: Frasier
text: But, not too much of a hurry. [_laughs_]

speaker: Officer
text: Well, drive safely.

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: What a clown.  I can tell you ten things he did wrong right off the bat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at least he was apologetic.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, these hick towns give any bozo a badge. [_the officer appears at the window and overhears_] A goober like that wouldn't last ten minutes in a real police force. [_notices the peeved officer_] ...without getting a promotion!

speaker: Officer
text: Your license! [_hands it over_] _Frasier drives off.  Frasier's mobile sounds and he answers.  The scene cuts back and forth between him and Niles, using his mobile near the pay phone in the restaurant._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.  I managed to solve the problem, I returned the Winnebago.

speaker: Frasier
text: To where?  Where are you?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm in Baker City, Oregon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Baker City?!

speaker: Martin
text: Shag me rotten!  That's three hundred miles!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, we will never get there and then back to Sun Valley before midnight.

speaker: Niles
text: Well I'm not going to ring in the new year in a "Little Red Cabin."

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, listen, the only way we can ever pull this off is if you can catch a ride in this direction.

speaker: Niles
text: Hold on, hold on. _In the Little Red Cabin, Niles uses the pay phone as a cover for eavesdropping on Betty and Clifford who are just leaving._

speaker: Betty
text: [_looking at lighter_] Oh my gosh, it's engraved.  Dad, I'm not going to enjoy the rest of this trip until I return this woman's lighter.

speaker: Clifford
text: Mother, do you expect me to turn around and drive a hundred and fifty miles back to that Little Red Cabin?  We are not going, end of discussion.

speaker: Betty
text: Clifford.

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone_] Good news, I'm on my way. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles says he can make it back to the restaurant where we first got separated, all I have to do now is to turn this boat around.

speaker: Martin
text: Thirty miles to the next exit.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't wait that long!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you can't do a U-ey on an interstate.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's twentieth century talk, Dad.  Welcome to the future! _We then see the Winnebago cut across the grass and into the other lane.  However, a police car is following them._

speaker: Frasier
text: God, that felt great!  Wow, this is really quite an adventure, isn't it, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: It is now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, just relax, Frasier.  Now, I know cops.  Just let me do the talking, and we'll be out of here in two minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right Dad, let's switch. _Martin moves into the driving seat.  The police officer comes to the window, it is the same one that arrested them earlier._

speaker: Officer
text: Well, look who's here.  Do you boys know what you did wrong back there?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah, I know, a U-turn.

speaker: Officer
text: Nope, called me a goober! _Martin and Frasier look worried.  FADE TO:_ **LATER THE SAME MILLENNIUM** _Scene Seven - The Little Red Cabin. Niles is sat in the cabin looking very bored.  A large waitress is on the tills as Frasier and Martin walk in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm so sorry we're late.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, well.  Not to worry, when you're here at the cross-roads of the world you have the human drama to amuse you.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, happy new year, boys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, five minutes ago!  Everyone in the world will have a wonderful story to tell about where they were and what they were doing when the Millennium dawned.  What is our story? Speeding along a lonely highway [_to Niles_] and you here doing nothing.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, not exactly nothing.  Big Sandy let me watch the register while she emptied the rat traps.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, wait a minute, where are we?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad, I've never seen a picture of the official middle of nowhere, but I assume...

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, but the middle of nowhere, Mountain Time, right?  It's still only 11:05 Pacific Time.

speaker: Niles
text: Which can't be more than forty-five minutes from here.

speaker: Martin
text: Right!  We can cross the line and toast in the new year.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, that's brilliant!  And there was a delightful little restaurant just across the border.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, the guide book said it was pretentious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perfect, let's roll! _The three exit the cabin.  FADE TO:  Scene Eight - The Winnebago. Martin is driving.  They are all dressed smartly in tuxedoes (even Eddie)._

speaker: Frasier
text: We're running out of time!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm doing my best, Frasier, but we seem to be losing power.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's that noise?  What's wrong with the engine?

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't touch the emergency brake!

speaker: Martin
text: When's the last time you put gas in this thing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?!  I don't even know where the thing is to put the gas into.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no.  I'm sorry, boys.  It's dying, I'm going to be lucky to get this off the road.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't stand this!  Have we so offended the Millennium gods that they will do anything to ruin this evening?  Burn down our restaurant?  Hurl vindictive lawmen and duplicate Winnebagos in our path to confound us?!

speaker: Martin
text: [_looks out of window_] Hey, is that a sign?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course it's a sign!  It's a sign that we're cursed!

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, it is, it's a sign!

speaker: Martin
text: We're entering Pacific Time Zone!  We're here!

speaker: Frasier
text: We made it!  Come on, Eddie! [_checks his watch_] Thirty seconds to spare. _The three gather round the champagne but the vehicle begins to roll back._

speaker: Frasier
text: We're rolling!  We're rolling backwards.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no!

speaker: Niles
text: No need to panic, Frasier.

speaker: Niles
text: Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

speaker: Martin
text: We rolled back into Idaho!

speaker: Frasier
text: Follow me! _Frasier grabs the champagne bottle out of the bucket and they all rush out of the Winnebago with Eddie and run up past the sign._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ten seconds, let's look alive. [_tries to open the champagne_] Damn this foil!

speaker: Martin
text: You can do it, Fras, relax and focus.

speaker: Niles
text: Three, two, one....

speaker: Martin
text: Oh-ho, we made it!  Happy New Year!

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: Happy New Year!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if you ask me, this beats a dull party.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah...

speaker: Niles
text: Family and good champagne and a blanket of stars.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_raises his cup_] Hear, hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, I think this calls for a song. [_sings_] "Should auld acquaintance be forgot..."

speaker: All
text: "...and never brought to mind.  Should-" _However, in the winds they hear coyotes howling.  Eddie runs back into the Winnebago.  Scared, the three follow him, finishing the lyrics._

speaker: All
text: [_rapidly_] "Should-old-acquaintance-be-forgot-for-Auld-Lang- Syne..." _They slam the door on the further sound of howling.  End of Act Two._
